oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Lorenzo Dow Atwood
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written from Milwaukee, Wisc., Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA, describes coming to Beloit, Wisc. which he calls a "copperhead city." He then proceeds to "Racene" [Racine] and Camp Washburn and eventually ships out to Tennessee, where his regiment is part of the garrison at Johnsonville (Tenn.) during the November 4, 1864 battle.
